Author: jspook16#3059
Content: data subscription opens up alot of possibilities. You can pick and choose which data gets recorded on the blockchain. Is there a way to prevent manipulation fo the data prior to being recorded on the blockchain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the data is defined to be X, with name, description and format

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then a data vendor can register to provide this data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: subscribers would then prepay specific data vendors, who also posted their datafee when they registered

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at first, dont prepay for a whole lot of data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so this becomes a trust the data vendor with a small amount, get the data and if all is good, prepay for longer and longer periods

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the prepayment is locked in a special CC address and the data provider can collect a datafee with each post, if the data is no good, then there wont be any more subscribers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it isnt 100% enforcement but for most things most of the time will keep the decent data coming onchain

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: i like it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the higher level CC will use this raw data and create a trustless aggregate out of it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as there can be arbitrary number of data providers for any given oracle

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it doesnt quite work for onetime oracle things, like results of a specific event, unless some category of event can be all provided, ie. sports results with enough data to describe what it is for

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just working out the details, one CC at a time. kind of like a jigsaw puzzle. the more pieces that find the right place, the clearer everything becomes

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: periodic satellite position data sounds like it can fit that bill

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: are there any block diagrams yet of the proposed CC architecture?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not a proposed CC architecture

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is an already working CC architecture

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I just write the code and debug it, no idea about charts

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: these are really more about making specific enhancements to the consensus rules, than a smart contract

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so not sure block diagrams can really convey anything other than some mysterious blocks, like the obelisk in 2001

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it works at the utxo level and creates a new type of vout that has to follow a new set of rules

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: lol ok. is there a place i can read more about CC? I knew it was utxo but i was under the impression these were more like smart contracts.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: total smart contract functionality would just be something that a single CC can do

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since it works at the consensus level, things like micropayments can be done, eg. channels CC

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: ok so the CCs you are coding are focused on the consensus rules then? did i understand that correctly?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there was a good article on reddit, but the best is: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/Mastering_CryptoConditions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each CC changes the consensus rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I am doing CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so I am indeed changing the consensus rules, but I have a feeling you are not quite understanding

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I wrote a plain english document in the above link. should give a good idea of what its about

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: I think i got it. CC affects consesus. I will read through the documentation. I want to be able to explain this in layman's terms to new folks (and I want to stay on top of what kmd is capable of)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I could make a C interpreter CC, ie. change the consensus rule so arbitrary C code in opreturn is executed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but I think doing such a general purpose CC is too dangerous

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it will also be interpreted so slower and opens up the entire looping issue, among many other issues

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont want to recreate all of ETH's problems, even though a single CC could allow that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so I am concentrating on fundamental CC that in turn add new rpc calls, and those can be used to create dapps of a certain type. The more fundamental CC, the more rpc calls, the more dapps can be done totally via rpc calls

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: kind of like creating a set of generating vectors with a maximum spectrum that they span

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: do you have control of which CCs are allowed in the system? or how is a "dangerous" CC prevented?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: most CC are just dormant until funded. and at worst only the funds put into the CC are at risk

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it gets all the protection of the utxo system, so its not like some crazy CC can create billions of new coins out of thin air

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this alone makes the CC much safer, it needs to be valid as normal utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for now all the enabled CC are available, but if nobody funds the faucet CC, there are not funds in the faucet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so nobody can do a faucetget

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if no funded dice plan, nobody can play dicebet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if no funded rewards plan, nobody can lock funds to get rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if nobody creates any assets, no assets to transfer or trade

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if nobody creates a channel, no channel payments can be made

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC dont use up "gas", just normal txfees, they are actually just normal tx with a new type of vout that has new rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is actually a lot more than smart contracts, even while it is safer, cheaper and much more efficient

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: oh i think i understand that...darn thats genius man. does the documentation show how to test the examples? I'm skimming through the link now

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is the testplan the testers used, it is just a matter to make cli calls

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: fund a CC, invoke a CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: usually using the txid of the funding transaction, but not always

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: global things like the faucet, you just make a faucetget call, no parameters

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then broadcast the transaction

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: is the transaction not broadcast as part of the CC?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i have it return a fully signed transaction all ready to be broadcast

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that way it can be verified before being broadcast, especially during the debug phase

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are some scripts that can automatically add a broadcast by extracting the hex and doing a sendrawtransaction

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: yeah i have one that i had to use for something else. I can reuse that ....but its good to know that I have to send it manually

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is just broadcast automatic, then if any problems there wont be an easy way to know what happened, it fits into a confirmation dialogue model

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: three new coders are being trained in writing CC contracts. not sure if all of them will be able to, but I am hopeful they all can

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: Im thinking it takes some serious understanding of the bitcoin protocol...(hence chapert 0 im assuming). If you can get at least one i'd say thats a win

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, it does need a coder that understands utxo to some degree, though that is really all that is absolutely needed as it is a highly constrained function that it does

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: do the CCs have to be coded in any given language

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it needs to be linked into komodod, so C/C++, rust, maybe go

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the go bindings arent existing yet, i think any language that can create a linkable library would work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you are calling internal bitcoin protocol codebase, DB, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is totally different than writing a solidity contract

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but a single assets CC, implemented token functionality with a built in DEX

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and we dont get the insanity of every token issuer copy pasting and changing some reference contract! that just seems so dangerous

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: everybody invokes the same tested assets CC via rpc calls

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes,so python likely can be used and call (be called by) the C/C++ codebase

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: are you coding in python

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: me?

Content: @Deleted User

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Pythoin would be very easy to code RPC calls and returns with. I used bash to create a simple CLI game, based on the DICE in STAKED. But it would have been easier in python I think in hindsight.

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: @jl777c can the same CC be used across asset chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all assetchains can activate CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: write a CC once and it is available on all chains and creates its set of rpc calls, which over time will get enough functionality to do vast majority of dapps via rpc calls, eg. not needing any custom CC.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is the long term goal

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: where we are surprised if some dapp requires a custom CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means bash can be used to make dapps
